intro: Tristemma littorale var. insulare, commonly known as the coastal morning glory, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows along sandy shores and tidal zones, where it thrives in saline and well-drained soils. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pale pink. This variety is notable for its ability to tolerate salt spray and fluctuating water levels, making it a resilient species in coastal ecosystems.
